comment: After one of Christine Blasey Fords former boyfriends made a statement to the FBI proving that Ford lied to Congress numerous times, CNN rushed to Fords defense with a hastily written error-filled attack article. The former boyfriend asked that his name remain redacted, but CNN doxxed him anyway as a warning to ensure nobody else speaks up.
amr:
# ::snt After one of Christine Blasey Fords former boyfriends made a statement to the FBI proving that Ford lied to Congress numerous times, CNN rushed to Fords defense with a hastily written error-filled attack article. The former boyfriend asked that his name remain redacted, but CNN doxxed him anyway as a warning to ensure nobody else speaks up.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (r / rush-01
            :ARG1 (p / publication
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "CNN"))
            :ARG2 (d / defend-01
                  :ARG0 p
                  :ARG1 (p2 / person
                        :name (n2 / name
                              :op1 "Christine"
                              :op2 "Blasey"
                              :op3 "Fords")))
            :time (a / after
                  :op1 (s / state-01
                        :ARG0 (p3 / person
                              :quant 1
                              :ARG1-of (ii / include-91
                                    :ARG2 (p4 / person
                                          :ARG0-of (h / have-rel-role-91
                                                :ARG1 p2
                                                :ARG2 (b / boyfriend)
                                                :time (f / former)))))
                        :ARG0-of (p5 / prove-01
                              :ARG1 (l / lie-08
                                    :ARG0 p4
                                    :ARG2 (g / government-organization
                                          :name (n3 / name
                                                :op1 "Congress"))
                                    :frequency (t / time
                                          :quant (n4 / numerous)))))))
      :snt2 (h2 / have-concession-91
            :ARG1 (d2 / doxx-01
                  :ARG0 p
                  :name (n5 / name
                        :op1 "CNN"))
            :ARG1 p2
            :mod (a2 / anyway)
            :purpose (e / ensure-01
                  :ARG0 p
                  :ARG1 (s2 / speak-up-02
                        :ARG0 (n6 / nobody
                              :mod (e2 / else)))))
      :ARG2 (a3 / ask-02
            :ARG0 (p6 / person
                  :ARG0-of h
                  :ARG1 p2
                  :ARG2 b
                  :time f))
      :ARG1 (r2 / remain-01
            :ARG1 (n7 / name
                  :poss p6)
            :ARG3 (r3 / redraw-01
                  :ARG1 n7)))

comment: Wait WTAF? Dude sent his shit confidentially to the Senate, complete with FULL obvious instructions to maintain OpSec, and *somebody* hot-potatoed it over to CNfuckingN? How did a NEWS organization get a hold of ANYTHING private to the Judiciary Committee? If THIS can happen then sorry McConnell, the whole damn thing has to get public air.
amr:
# ::snt Wait WTAF? Dude sent his shit confidentially to the Senate, complete with FULL obvious instructions to maintain OpSec, and *somebody* hot-potatoed it over to CNfuckingN? How did a NEWS organization get a hold of ANYTHING private to the Judiciary Committee? If THIS can happen then sorry McConnell, the whole damn thing has to get public air.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (w / wait-01
            :mode imperative
            :ARG1 (p / person
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "WTAF")))
      :snt2 (a / and
            :op1 (s / send-01
                  :ARG0 (d / dude)
                  :ARG1 (s2 / shit
                        :poss d)
                  :ARG2 (g / government-organization
                        :name (n2 / name
                              :op1 "Senate"))
                  :manner (c / confident-01)
                  :ARG1-of (c2 / complete-01
                        :ARG2 (ii / instruct-01
                              :ARG1 d
                              :ARG2 (m2 / maintain-01
                                    :ARG0 d
                                    :ARG1 (g2 / government-organization
                                          :name (n3 / name
                                                :op1 "OPSec")))
                              :ARG1-of (o / obvious-01
                                    :degree (f / full)))))
            :op2 (p2 / potato-00
                  :ARG0 (s3 / somebody)
                  :ARG1 s2
                  :ARG2 (p3 / publication
                        :name (n4 / name
                              :op1 "CNFuckingN"))
                  :manner (f2 / fuck-01
                        :mode expressive)))
      :snt3 (g3 / get-22
            :ARG0 (o2 / organization
                  :mod (n5 / news))
            :ARG1 (h / hold-01
                  :ARG0 o2
                  :ARG1 (a2 / anything
                        :ARG1-of (p4 / private-02))
                  :ARG2 (g4 / government-organization
                        :name (n6 / name
                              :op1 "Judiciary"
                              :op2 "Committee")))
            :manner (a3 / amr-unknown)
            :condition (p5 / possible-01
                  :ARG1 (e / event
                        :mod (t / this))))
      :snt4 (s4 / sorry-01
            :ARG1 (p6 / person
                  :name (n7 / name
                        :op1 "McConnell"))
            :condition (p7 / possible-01
                  :ARG1 e)))

# ::snt Two words: Feinstein's Office
(w / word
      :quant 2
      :source (o / office
            :poss (p / person
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "Feinstein"))))

comment: I think you can still make an impactful statement by removing the hateful language from your rhetoric.
amr:

(t / think-01
      :ARG0 (ii / i)
      :ARG1 (p / possible-01
            :ARG1 (m / make-01
                  :ARG0 (y / you)
                  :ARG1 (s / state-01
                        :ARG0 y
                        :mod (s2 / still)
                        :manner (r / remove-01
                              :ARG0 y
                              :ARG1 (l / language
                                    :ARG0-of (h / hate-01))
                              :ARG2 (r2 / rhetoric
                                    :poss y)))
                  :ARG0-of (ii2 / impact-01))))

comment: Please refrain from using hateful homophobic language in your posts.  It is unproductive and adds nothing valuable to the discussion.
amr:
# ::snt Please refrain from using hateful homophobic language in your posts.  It is unproductive and adds nothing valuable to the discussion.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (r / refrain-01
            :mode imperative
            :polite +
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :ARG1 (u / use-01
                  :ARG0 y
                  :ARG1 (l / language
                        :mod (h / homophobia)
                        :ARG0-of (h2 / hate-01))
                  :location (p / post-01
                        :ARG0 y)))
      :snt2 (a / and
            :op1 (p2 / productive-03
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG0 (ii / it))
            :op2 (a2 / add-02
                  :ARG0 ii
                  :ARG1 (n / nothing
                        :ARG1-of (v / value-02
                              :ARG2 (d / discuss-01)))
                  :ARG2 ii)))
